豲字的基本解释

豲
huán
yu俷
豪猪：“故狐有牙而不敢以噬，豲有爪而不敢以撅。”

豲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［huán］
［《廣韻》胡官切，平桓，匣。］
亦作“1”。
(1)豪猪。
(2)传说中的兽名。
(3)古时西北少数民族邑名。

豲字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【豕字部】　豲； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1198第16
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?胡官切，音桓。【說文】豕之逸也。【博雅】豕屬。【逸周書·周祝解】豲有爪而不敢以獗。【前漢·揚雄傳註】豪豬一名豲，自爲牝牡者也。　又【玉篇】亦作?。【山海經註】豪彘，?豬也。　又【玉篇】縣名。【前漢·地理志】天水郡有豲道縣。　又【廣韻】亦作獂。【史記·秦本紀】斬戎之獂王。【註】獂，戎邑。　又或作䝠。【史記·匈奴列傳】隴西有翟䝠之戎。【徐廣曰】在天水。　又【集韻】愚袁切，音元。亦豕屬。　【正字通】唐本《說文》豲，豕屬。徐本攺訓豕逸，非。豲本義从唐本爲是。

豲字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
豲字的起名意思

暂无。

Pen
Basic explanation of words
Pen
huán
yu
Porcupine: "Therefore, the fox has teeth and dare not eat it, but it has claws and dare not poke it."
Pen
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [huán]
["Guangyun" Hu Guanqie, Pinghuan, Xie. ]
Also known as "1".
(1) Porcupine.
(2) The legendary animal name.
(3) The name of the northwest minority towns in ancient times.
Pen
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Youth Collection】【Wu Character Department】　豲; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1198 Page 16
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun]? Hu Guan cut, Yin Huan. [Said the text] The Yi of the hog. 【Boya】The genus hog. [Yi Zhou Shu·Zhou Zhu Jie] He has claws and dare not use it. [Previous Han·Yang Xiong's Biography] A porcupine is a horror, and he is also a masculine man.　[Jade articles] also made?. [Notes to Shan Hai Jing] Hao Yu,? Pig.　[Jade articles] The name of the county. [Pre-Han Geography] There is Bendao County in Tianshui County.　[Guangyun] Also used as a 獂. 【Historical Records·Qin Benji】The Roe King of Slaying Rong. [Note] Roe, Rongyi.　Or do it again. [Historical Records: The Biography of the Xiongnu] There is the Rong of Zhai Ni in Longxi. [Xu Guangyue] In Tianshui.　[Jiyun] Yu Yuan cut, phoneme. Also the genus hog.　【Zhengzitong】The Tang version of "Shuowen" is 豲, genus of hog. Xu Benxun Xun Yi, non. The original meaning of Ben is from Tang.
